The 'nanometre' (International spelling as used by the International Bureau of
Weights and Measures; SI symbol: 'nm') or 'nanometer' (American spelling) is a
unit of length in the metric system, equal to one billionth of a metre. The
name combines the SI prefix nano- (from the Ancient Greek , {{lang|grc-
Latn|nanos}}, "dwarf") with the parent unit name metre (from Greek , {{lang|grc-
Latn|metrÎ¿n}}, "unit of measurement"). It can be written in scientific
notation as 1×10 −9  m, in engineering notation as ,
and is simply .
